I used the following ruby script to check the contents of the files

```ruby
require 'pathname'

DUBBO_ROOT_PATH = '/Users/richard/Repositories/dubbo/'
DUBBO_ROOT_PATH_NAME = Pathname.new(DUBBO_ROOT_PATH)
source_files = Dir[File.join(DUBBO_ROOT_PATH, '**/*.java')]

def check_file_content(files)
  files.each do |file_name|
    content = File.read(file_name)
    puts Pathname.new(file_name).relative_path_from(DUBBO_ROOT_PATH_NAME) if yield(content)
  end
end

check_file_content(source_files) { |content| content !~ /Scott Ferguson/ && content !~ %r(http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0) } # check the license
check_file_content(source_files) { |content| content =~ /@author(?! Scott Ferguson)|Created by/ } # check the author information
check_file_content(source_files) { |content| content =~ /\p{Han}/ } # check Chinese characters
```
thanks

Updated ruby script

```ruby
require 'pathname'

DUBBO_ROOT_PATH = '/Users/richard/Repositories/dubbo/'
DUBBO_ROOT_PATH_NAME = Pathname.new(DUBBO_ROOT_PATH)
source_files = Dir[File.join(DUBBO_ROOT_PATH, '**/*.java')]

without_hessian_lite_source_files = source_files.reject { |file_name| file_name =~ /hessian-lite/ }
def check_file_content(files)
  files.each do |file_name|
    content = File.read(file_name)
    puts Pathname.new(file_name).relative_path_from(DUBBO_ROOT_PATH_NAME) if yield(content)
  end
end

check_file_content(without_hessian_lite_source_files) { |content| content !~ /Autogenerated by/ && !content.include?('Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more') }
check_file_content(without_hessian_lite_source_files) { |content| content =~ /@author|Created by/ }
check_file_content(source_files) { |content| content =~ /\p{Han}/ }
```

这样处理没问题吧？集群部署就是为了避免单机崩溃的。一个接口它既是提供者又是消费者。那么机器挂了之后不仅仅提供者挂了，消费者也挂了。消费者也没有可能去找别的机器调用了。 而且不会进行分布式调用，还减小了网络传输的带宽消耗

@mercyblitz 这个方法是不是只有 spring boot 项目可用啊？

You can use @Activate annotation on your Filter, it will guarantee your Filters be invoked automatically  when condition matches.
See [@Activate for details](http://dubbo.io/books/dubbo-dev-book/SPI.html)

@wing-only  If a service is exported and referenced in the same application, dubbo will always refer the inner service instance by default (`InjvmProtocol`), avoiding network costs. If you want to change this default behavior, set `scope=remote`, click [here](http://dubbo.io/books/dubbo-user-book/demos/local-call.html) for more details.

@gxh123 @cuiken 
Why you can't successfully connect to the ZK server in 30000? Isn't this a potential problem?
And besides, ZkclientWrapper will keep monitoring the connection effort to ZK server, and take care of the connection when it's finally connected.

This is only a problem of your developing environment, so we don't recommend degrade to 2.5.6.

We are considering support the original ` Thrift RPC Protocol`, this can solve the communication problem when your need to program cross languages. But still, our service management ability only restricted to `java`, because we don't have multi-language implementations for dubbo core features. Maybe in the future, we will figure out a plan like Service Mesh to solve this problem.

This is a problem that is closely related to your environment and project.
And besides, i don't fully understand the problem through your description, you mean all 6 seconds cost on the provider side?
@chickenlj yes ,it's right! In jdk7,all green,in jdk8 red.But is there any other way to solve the problem besides switching javassist?
@mercyblitz Thank you very much!In our new project,we uesd dubbo2.5.8 and @DubboComponentScan  ,So far, no problems have been found!

We have tried to avoid introduce a new dependency with `dubbo-qos`, but the output of telnet needs to be formatted and it is pretty tricky. 

I think add `commons-lang3` as transitive dependency is not a good choice as it may cause some implicit dependency conflicts.

1. We can add a instruction in [documentation](http://dubbo.io/books/dubbo-user-book/references/qos.html), declaring that `commons-lang3` is a necessary for `dubbo-qos` module, and also this can be quite reasonable when we user can decide whether to use `dubbo-qos` or not. Also see #1073.
2. We can discuss the possibility of avoid using `commons-lang3` again.

In the following several releases,  we will continue focus on improving the core dubbo features, so we may not have too much resources supporting `API Gateway` or some requirements like this.

But i do think this can be a part of our long-term plan.We will try to build a sound eco-system around dubbo core RPC, or at least we can try adapt to other eco-systems that provide this features.
fixed in https://github.com/alibaba/dubbo/issues/1044
We are reviewing the code, we plan to release this part in the next few days.

Simply put, dubbo will focus on RPC, Spring Cloud want to provide a complete solution for microservices architecture, we will try to adapt to Spring Cloud as a RPC solution. 

I recommend you watch [this video](http://www.itdks.com/eventlist/detail/1809), here i give a detailed description of this question.

Firstly, in production, i think 30s is a pretty long time, if you can not build a connection to ZK server, there may have a potential problem.

Secondly, we do this to prevent unlimited waiting when ZK server can not be reached in a really long time. If you use `<dubbo:registry check="false"/>`, this mechanism will make sure your application use the cached data of registry and continue working, and when you finally build a connection to ZK server,  ZkclientWrapper will use this connection and keep sync to ZK server automatically.
And if you don't use `<dubbo:registry check="false"/>` and you can not connect to ZK server in 30s, your application will fail to start.

Currently, according to the [code](https://github.com/alibaba/dubbo/blob/master/dubbo-plugin/dubbo-qos/src/main/java/com/alibaba/dubbo/qos/server/Server.java#L81), the qos module is enabled by default and has no option to turn it off.

If a new option like `telnet.open=true/false` could be added, then I think it's reasonable the user should follow the instructions to enable this feature with an explicit dependency.
You can use `@EnableDubboConfigBinding(prefix = "${spring.application.name}", type = ApplicationConfig.class)` if your dubbo's version >= `2.5.8`
Or use `@EnableDubbo`

The redis registry is implemented on a really old redis version, a version neither support sentinel nor cluster. You can also see dubbo build it's own cluster solution on redis.

We have upgrade the jedis version to 2.9.0, but we still haven't use the features like sentinel or cluster.

给出更详细的问题如下，帮助代码review的同学快速定位问题。
1. 构建hash环的缓存使用interface+method作为key，泛化调用通过getMethodName()获得方法名始终为"$invoke"，相当于混用了hash环。

2. 使用argumentIndex针对指定参数的下标进行hash结点计算，但是由于泛化场景下，invocation.getArguments()得到的不是真实的参数，因此会导致计算错误，不是预期的hash结果。

3. identityHashCode通过invoker的hashcode方法直接得到。但是invoker对象计算时会将url内容计算进去，url包含调用时间戳，每次都变，hash环每次都会失效重建。

4. 虚拟节点hash环持有invoker对象引用，个人认为loadbalance作为一个策略tool，尽量不需持有对整个工作流具有重要意义的invoker。

已经提交了pull request，#1144
这个方式怎么能够说优雅呢？又不是servlet。

@Lazy(true)行不行
这个是什么错误，没明白为什么会失败

我使用yml文件配置这3个配置项, 好像并不生效

dubbo.protocol.id = dubbo
dubbo.protocol.name = dubbo
dubbo.protocol.port = 12345

我的配置文件:
```
dubbo:
  application:
    name: showcase-provider
  registry:
    address: zookeeper://x.x.x.x:2181
  protocol:
    id: dubbo
    name: dubbo
    port: 30000
```
启动日志中看到的:
```
2018-01-03 10:04:57.302  INFO 5004 --- [  restartedMain] c.a.d.r.zookeeper.ZookeeperRegistry      :  [DUBBO] Notify urls for subscribe url provider://x.x.x.x:20880/xxx
```

解决方案:
在yml文件中, 将port指定为字符串
```
dubbo:
  protocol:
    port: "30000"
```

@chickenlj，谢谢回复，我的问题是，压测场景，并发数梯度增长到tps峰值之后，打印线程stack日志，此时总线程数200多(包括IO和请求处理线程)，但是runnable状态的线程数始终维持在10个左右，大部分均处于waiting (parking)状态，此时继续增加并发，tps会下降，并且响应时间会增长，线程处理机制不太合理，正常的机制应当是将waiting的线程释放来处理更多的请求。
为了验证是否为Dubbo框架的问题，我们使用了淘宝的专门针对Dubbo的压测工具，并且搭建简单的Dubbo服务进行压测，压测结果和Dubbo官网基本一致，并且work线程数仍然固定在10个左右，将consumer端connector数调整为20(原始值为1)，tps会有部分增长，work线程数也会有适当增长，但是和connector增长数不是线性增长。

@stoneapple It looks like a compilation error

Currently, we support both netty3 (`dubbo-remoting-netty`) and netty4 (`dubbo-remoting-netty4`), so we have to depend on both.
By default, only netty3 works as a transitive dependency of `dubbo.jar`, netty4 is an optional dependency chosen by user.
